The natural response to riots & the city on fire...we need fewer police. #ThisIsNuts https://twitter.com/nycmayor/status/1269650502284972032 QT @NYCMayor This morning we committed to move resources from the NYPD to youth and social services as part of our City’s budget.
 
Our young people need to be reached, not policed.
 
We can do this AND keep our city safe.

true https://twitter.com/bucksexton/status/1269343897039310848 QT @BuckSexton I grew up in an unsafe NYC with over 2000 murders a year. Last year it was around 300. Policing rescued this city.

NYPD has saved, statistically, thousands of lives over the last two decades

And based on the numbers, those were mostly minority lives. 

“defund cops” is evil

This...is...insane.

If Minneapolis (and NYC and DC) follow through on the radical Left’s plan to “defund the police” MANY more black lives will be lost. 

#ThisIsNuts https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1269780310952116227 QT @washingtonpost "Defund the police" movement gains traction as cities seek to respond to demands for a major law enforcement shift https://trib.al/Yml8u0Q

RT @exjon The Girondins have purged the impure Jacobins. Next up, the Montagnards will purge the Girondins. https://twitter.com/marcatracy/status/1269722847359971331 QT @marcatracy NEW James Bennet has resigned

The NYT literally fired their editorial page editor because he dared publish an op-ed that Leftists disagreed with. 

The totalitarian Left will brook no dissent. To hell with Free Speech—we are Pravda. 

New York Times: founded as an actual newspaper 9/18/1851.

Died: 6/7/2020. https://twitter.com/marcatracy/status/1269724593712922624 QT @marcatracy Letter from AG Sulzberger: Bennet has resigned; JIm Dao stepping off masthead and away from opinion; Katie Kingsbury acting editorial page editor thru election. Letter to staff from AG Sulzberger http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ73yPEXQAAbsf5.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ73yPHXsAIdZsH.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ73yPEXQAM8_M7.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ73yPGXsAEhtU9.jpg

“Therefore, if you bring your gift to the altar, and there recall that your brother has anything against you,leave your gift there at the altar, go first and be reconciled with your brother, and then come and offer your gift.”

Matthew 5:23-24

Unemployment corrected to 16.3%.
Black unemployment 16.8%, the highest in more than 10 years.
Latino unemployment 17.6%.

Any leader taking a victory lap over these numbers is completely out of touch with working people. We have so much more work to do. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/05/may-2020-jobs-report-misclassification-error/
It comes down to this, no nation can prosper & thrive if a significant percentage of her people believe their lives are valued less than the lives of everyone else.

Heartbroken for Robert Forbes’ family and loved ones. We need to know whether this tragedy was intentional. https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/claudiakoerner/robert-forbes-killed-driver-bakersfield-protest

We need to work from the ground up to transform our society. It’s clear we cannot wait any longer to act forcefully and boldly to root out systemic racism and police violence. And when we act together, we win. https://twitter.com/iowacci/status/1269013752567005187 QT @iowacci We are making big moves towards addressing the root causes of our pain. The City Council is paying attention. The anti-racial profiling ordinance is on the agenda because the people got it there. @DesMoinesBLM made this possible. #PowerToThePeople #BlackLivesMatter https://twitter.com/iowacci/status/1268301272958066688

The lunatic Left now says it’s a sign of “privilege” not to want your home broken into. #ThisIsNuts https://twitter.com/eddiezipperer/status/1269951088964370432 QT @EddieZipperer CAMEROTA: "What if in the middle of the night my home is broken into. Who do I call?"

BENDER: "Yes, I hear that loud and clear from a lot of my neighbors. And I know — and myself, too, and I know that that comes from a place of privilege." http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1269950974673727489/pu/img/X28mQH2-irH8huAM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1269950974673727489/pu/vid/486x270/nN7RIbwoed85fcgi.mp4?tag=10

RT @ByronYork Minneapolis City Council moving to 'end' city police department. But what's remarkable about 'defund the police' is how little public discussion there has been about what it would actually mean in practice...  1/7 https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/byron-yorks-daily-memo-defund-the-police-defund-the-police

true https://twitter.com/shaunking/status/1268911183878410246 QT @shaunking STOP generically telling us to VOTE in response to all of the police brutality we have right now.

Yes we should vote. But we have to be VERY specific.

Democrats, from top to bottom, are running the cities with the worst police brutality in America right now.

We voted for them.

yup https://twitter.com/jerrydunleavy/status/1269955188456067076 QT @JerryDunleavy Open & activist partisan bias, except touting it as some new & moral development rather than continuing to deceptively deny it. https://twitter.com/brianstelter/status/1269757501328756738

RT @SpeakerPelosi Across the country, Americans are calling for action to end police brutality and racial injustice. Today, @HouseDemocrats & @SenateDems are unveiling the #JusticeInPolicing Act. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1yNGaBamjzdJj

The murders of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery and countless others must be met with decisive action. Watch here as I join @SenBooker, @TheBlackCaucus, and Congressional leaders to announce our reforms to hold police accountable. https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1270002623291195392 QT @SpeakerPelosi Across the country, Americans are calling for action to end police brutality and racial injustice. Today, @HouseDemocrats & @SenateDems are unveiling the #JusticeInPolicing Act. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1yNGaBamjzdJj

Across the country, Americans are calling for action to end police brutality and racial injustice. Today, @HouseDemocrats & @SenateDems are unveiling the #JusticeInPolicing Act. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1yNGaBamjzdJj

Bills are piling up, rent is due, millions are jobless. A one-time $1,200 check won’t cut it.

We need to provide $2,000 a month to every man, woman and child—and make it retroactive to cover the past three months.

If we can bail out corporations, we can ensure everyone’s needs.

Today I’m leading a broad coalition of Congress Members & advocates—including over ⅔ of the @SenateDems caucus—to introduce comprehensive legislation that would make substantive changes to our system of policing, hold police accountable & more. Watch live—https://www.c-span.org/video/?472850-1/congressional-democrats-hold-news-conference-police-reform

House & Senate Democrats are coming together at 10:30 am ET to unveil the #JusticeInPolicing Act of 2020.

Tune in here: https://www.facebook.com/NancyPelosi/

This is a moral moment in the history of our country and we must answer it with action. There is an urgent need for comprehensive reforms to our system of policing—that’s what our Justice in Policing Act will get done. The time for change is now. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EaAGgX5WsAAL8Bk.png

RT @RepKarenBass The Justice in Policing Act of 2020 will hold abusive law enforcement officers accountable, change the culture of law enforcement and build trust between law enforcement and our communities.

It establishes a bold, transformative vision of policing in America.

Today we act.

RT @SenBooker Today I’m leading a broad coalition of Congress Members & advocates—including over ⅔ of the @SenateDems caucus—to introduce comprehensive legislation that would make substantive changes to our system of policing, hold police accountable & more. Watch live—https://www.c-span.org/video/?472850-1/congressional-democrats-hold-news-conference-police-reform

RT @SenKamalaHarris We just announced the first ever comprehensive police accountability and reform bill to:

- Create a national standard for use of force 
- Expand pattern and practice investigations into police departments
- Increase independent investigations into police misconduct

RT @CBSNews Nancy Pelosi: "The martyrdom of George Floyd gave the American experience a moment of national anguish, as we grieve for the black Americans killed by police brutality. Today, this movement of national anguish is being transformed into a movement of national action" http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1270006300697604097/img/8oatPmvIYUzUu8P5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1270006300697604097/vid/480x270/eEg99uDp5jF4vlRQ.mp4?tag=13

🗳 HOW TO VOTE IN NY:

Absentee: Apply by June 16th, return by June 23rd

Early Voting: 🚨 Early voting starts THIS SATURDAY, June 13th! (check locations via our link)

Election Day: Cast your ballot on TUESDAY, JUNE 23rd.

Plan at https://www.ocasiocortez.com/vote, absentee info below ⬇️ http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1270080320025563138/pu/img/vmWlrCJFmms_zv-y.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1270080320025563138/pu/vid/320x320/CHCQU96d4EAs0Q1a.mp4?tag=10

Black and brown communities are overcriminalized and overpoliced. We must address police brutality with bold action and swift accountability.

Today, I announced the Justice in Policing Act to hold police accountable for misconduct. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/08/democrats-to-unveil-sweeping-police-reform-bill-307108
